pros: There is nothing good that I can say about this company.
cons: This company is unorganized, and they take advantage of their staff. Look closely at their photos. You’ll never see the same people in the same year.

pros: the employees are kind and hard working
cons: The management is terrible and it shows in every layer of the business

review_title: Not a company to grow with
pros:
-The concept of the school is wonderful; giving non-traditional students a chance to pursue careers. 
- It is a small school, so there is a a lot of freedom to try different techniques to improve methods
- Great location; near Farragut West & Farragut North
cons:
- Unfortunately, the management (which basically consists of the husband & wife who own & run the company) are not interested in having the company grow. They hire and fire people on a weekly basis without any care, consideration or warning. 
- You will consistently be micromanaged and no matter how much work you do, they will make you feel like you are not doing enough and keep pushing you to do more. 
- The students sometimes get frustrated at the staff & lash out at them in the form of using curse words & slamming doors & threats.  There are no consequences for that.
- The husband & wife duo will have frequent department meetings where they will throw out personal insults at you. If you speak out against it, they will tell you that you are too sensitive
- Admissions department has too much pressure to meet numbers as a result of which they always bring in students who are homeless, have a learning disability, have a mental health condition or are overall not fit to be in school. They consistently bring back students who had been previously dropped.

review_title: A disservice and disgrace to the students, society and higher education.
pros: Location. Metro accessible from Farragut North and Farragut West. Paid on time and accurately (most of the time). Coworkers with a good sense of humor.
cons: This place is making money at any cost off of the backs of black, brown, immigrant and low-income individuals. They set up a system that puts the students in more debt to them than they already are. They prey on these above mentioned communities’ lack of knowledge and education on how proprietary schools work. They make it out like they are changing lives and doing favors for the students (and employees) when really their own interests and pockets are at the center of all decisions. It is clear that not one person in management has a degree in business administration or management. The Department of Education needs to crack down on these diploma programs ran by individuals for solely profitable reasons. Additionally, they train these individuals closely working under them to be their puppets and it is quite sad to watch, but they are grown adults and choose to be treated and trained in this manner. The unfortunate part is that these individuals lose who they are as individuals in order to keep their dead end job.

review_title: Pay Attention To the Negative Reviews! Most of the Positive Ones are Fake!
pros: Faculty and Student Support Staff Are Fantastic.
cons:
I encourage you to read the previous reviews of this place- but not the fake, five star ones. The authentic reviews are true.

I can’t add much to the conversation except this: the CEO and CFO constantly contridicting one another. One asks you to complete a task one way, and then the other person will tell you something completely different. It’s an awful environment for employees to deal with. There’s a gaping gash of inconsistent vision and direction. This is ultimately why I couldn’t had to resign. 

Also and perhaps most importantly, student policies are changed on a whim. Studehts are promised something, like that graduation fees will be covered or some type of reward will be given, or transportation assistance is promised, then revoked without any notification or reason. It’s not fair to the students. 

The teachers and student support staff are amazing and are committed to doing the best they can under such poor leadership and being ruled by an utter lack of executive vision.

review_title: No idea how I made it so long.
pros: Thank god the job was part time, I couldn't survive this place if it was an 8 hour shift.  As a flyer distributor you are working outside, so that's a plus.
cons: Even though you're working outside as a flyer distributor you're monitored by GPS on your location, and you get face-timed to ensure you are at that location. You are not trusted. Management doesn't care about staff, or current students. They only care about new enrollments, and once they are enrolled, they forget about them. Management is quick to change their mind. Everyone is fake towards the Management, but the staff are just fake because they just want to get through the day. Also Management doesn't trust staff. You are constantly being watched, and then asked question. When answered, your answer is never enough as the management would push you to the extreme, even if its unrealistic.

job_title: Project Management Intern in Washington, DC
pros:
- Great Concept: Prospect College providing non-traditional students a chance to pursue careers.  
- Growth  Opportunity: Its a small school with growing potential, so there is a a lot of freedom to try different techniques to improve methods
- Excellent Location: Downtown DC is very convenient and Metro accessible (near Farragut West & Farragut North)
-Work-Life Balance: Office hours are usually standard. You will get good balance of working in office as well as spending time at home.
cons: -Software Implementation: Update is required on few software. But new management is working on it, so most probably that should be sorted.

Never work here this place is terrible . There is no growth so do not even think about it, the longest employee has been here 2 years, that's terrible . Management talks down to you and feels like you owe them because they hired you which is ridiculous! The management will talk to you like your low & disrespect you. If you like being micromanaged , making low pay & being treated like a peasant go can't excel then this is the place for you take my advice and RUNNNNNN ! This place is a curse

Management is abusive, rude and they talk down to you as if you're a peasant. This is by far the worst place to work. The students disrespect you and you are micromanaged when you are doing your job. Please do not get sucked in during the interview and work here, why do you think nobody has lasted longer than a year ?

pros: Metro Accessible, Many places to dine!
cons:
Over Poor, unhealthy management also Poor communication and no growth opportunity. Constant firing of employees leaves all departments understaffed 
and employees put on extreme stress. 
 
* They treat you as if you are their enemy, there is no trust. They ask other employees about your performance. The wife likes to have one or two employees close to her to keep them as puppets so she can gossip. It's unfortunate that money can buy things but can't buy you class or  buy a man dignity and unbending principle.
* monitored by surveillance cameras everywhere, including break room. 
* Line gets crossed every time  by both husband and wife. They are very rude, 
    *They treat you as if they are doing you a favor because they hired you.
* Very sad to witness, These morally shallow owners run a company with 
  tremendous lack of respect to others & lack of taking full responsibility to their 
   actions. Employees rights and equal opportunity are violated. 
* They have hired many for less than a week. They are unable to make decisions 
   on their own, so you will be left to the judgement of many. 
* Since they hire directors almost every couple months each director that comes 
  make them selves important by firing employees. 
* My advice don't waste your time joining this company spend your time 
   searching a better opportunity where you can grow don't work here out of 
  desperation, it will cost your precious time and headache.
* They treat the students as numbers, one more 16,000 to their wealth/They 
   don't prepare them to be successful, they push them through all the way. 
* Husband & wife are involved but they don't have knowledge of their company's 
    departments therefore they expect a lot in return. 
* New policy everyday. You come to work expecting the unknown.
*   Admissions are obligate to meet certain numbers every 20 days therefor they  
   use  incentives to bring students.  The wrong doings of this company is endless, I don't understand how we are in the USA in the heart of DC yet all these violations are over looked.
